description: Jerry Aleman, a 41-year-old Perris resident, was found unresponsive in his cell Wednesday and died at the detention facility
story_text: Man jailed at George Bailey in Otay Mesa dies, sheriff's officials say A 41-year-old Riverside County man jailed since his January arrest in Carlsbad died Wednesday at the George F. Bailey Detention Center in Otay Mesa, sheriff’s officials said. Jerry Aleman, of Perris, was found unresponsive in his cell around 5 p.m. and died at the county jail despite resuscitation efforts by deputies, medical staff and later firefighters, sheriff’s Lt. Thomas Seiver said. The county Medical Examiner’s Office conducted an autopsy Thursday, but the cause and manner of Aleman’s death had not yet been determined, Seiver said in a news release. The autopsy resulted in a presumptive positive test for fentanyl, though “further laboratory testing is required to confirm” the suspected drug use, Seiver said. Thursday’s disclosure of Aleman’s death followed a pledge made by sheriff’s officials in April to announce jail deaths within 24 hours . In recent years, department officials had waited months to disclose in-custody deaths until complete autopsy results and internal Sheriff’s Department investigations were finalized. Deaths have plagued San Diego County’s jails for more than a decade, according to a six-month investigation published by the Union-Tribune in 2019, which found San Diego County had the highest jail-mortality rate among California’s largest counties . Overall, more than 150 men and women have died in Sheriff’s Department custody since 2009, records show. Sheriff’s homicide detectives are investigating Aleman’s death, as is typical for all in-custody deaths regardless of whether they are suspicious in nature. Carlsbad police arrested Aleman Jan. 18, and Seiver said he’d been jailed since then on suspicion of more than two dozen crimes, including 18 counts of various identity theft accusations, as well as forgery, fraud and other related charges. . .
title: Man jailed at George Bailey in Otay Mesa dies, sheriff's officials say
